noun.description: A person who advocates or supports a system of government in which several states unite under a central authority.
examples: the ideas of the European federalists

noun.description: A member or supporter of the Federalist Party.
examples: they captured both the legislative and the executive branches of the federal government from the Federalists

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting a system of government in which several states unite under a central authority.
examples: the federalist structure of the American system of government

adjective.description: Designating or pertaining to the Federalist Party.
examples: it was not a weapon that could reach the Federalist judges
